title: When will 300 million people in India receive at least one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine?
preds: Rate has picked up. Looks like about 7 more days to hit 300 mil, which is well ahead of August 1st.

192 in june 9 - Rate 3/day = 36 days
215 in june 17 - Rate 2,875/day = 30 days
253 in june 25 - Rate 4,7/day  = 10 days
238.6M June 22 meaning 4.7M/day over the last week and continues to accelerate. Should be early July now so I'm moving to 100%
As of June 21st, first dose vaccinations at 182.18 m and full vaccinations at 50.57 m for a total of 232.75 m. Daily rate seems stabilised at 3 mpd.

new vaccination policy came into force on Monday and highest number of vaccinations were given to date. nearly 8mil 1st vaccinations in a day and the government hopes that the numbers will increase in the next two weeks. At this rate we could reach 300mil by 1st July let alone 1st August.
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/covid-record-85-lakh-doses-on-day-1-of-new-vaccine-policy/articleshow/83733442.cms Very happy to go to 100% now

210.4m as of June 16 meaning avg of 3.14m/day and 29 days until 300m at current rate putting it potentially mid-July. Since rate is increasing over the last week as well, that combined with the now 2 week buffer makes it seem almost certain to happen before Aug 1.

Indian government has announced that the interval between doses can now be 12-16 weeks. If this decision sticks and supply remains constant, then this pretty much guarantees that 300 million will be done in July. Only risk is supply issue, with manufacturing, or some health decision to bring them forward. Ina decreasing case climate I think that's unlikely.

192 in june 9 - Rate 3/day = 36 days
215 in june 17 - Rate 2,875/day = 30 days

need 1.9M per day to reach 1 Aug target It hasn't been this low on average since May. Typically it is 2.5 to 3
Was at 85% gone to 95%. possibly overconfident but can't findand evidence that this will change.
if get 2 weeks at 3m/day then the remainder only needs to average 1.4m/d so at current rate there will be a good buffy by the end of the month. Unless something changes I will likely go 100% in 2 weeks
I like what I'm seeing. Good for India. *applause*
approx 200M vaccinated w 1 dose. rate still approx 2.5-3 M/day.

First doses have been increasing at about +2.8 mil/day for about the past two weeks, and the trend seems to be steady. With nearly 200 mil people who have already had a first dose as of the time of writing, that puts us at about 35 days to hit 300 mil. I anticipate vaccination rates will increase with additional anticipated supply, at least for the near future.

The primary doubt: https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-india-55571793 I'm not that worried that the curve will flatten before August judging that a month-long boost in doses was observed through March, based on JHU data, which is a little bit below the Indian figures I suppose.
Rates are high, vaccines are plentiful, states have been told to increase efforts

188.4m as of June 8 which means its progressing faster than anticipated (~2.67m/day rather than the 1.5m as of my June 3 forecast) and fast approaching the 3m/day that was talked about. If the current rate sustains (which now seems viable) that puts us ~42 days or July 21st, well ahead of Aug 1. With the govt. taking control of the majority of vaccine distribution they'll likely push even more to increase uptake. Barring major production issues India now seems well placed to achieve 300m before of Aug 1 https://www.indiatoday.in/coronavirus-outbreak/story/india-vaccination-coverage-covid19-narendra-modi-health-1811966-2021-06-07
https://globalnews.ca/news/7927492/covid-india-vaccine-reopening/

- Increasing probability of making it before August 10x (2 -> 20%) because the number of first doses has yet to drop off, and there is suggestion that production will increase prior to August (although it's not actually clear if the 40% increase in production in June will translate to available doses immediately).
- Looking increasingly like my prediction of <200 million first doses by August will be way off, poised to hit that next week.
- Not increasing it that much since the second doses haven't really taken off yet. There is  >100 million who will need a second dose before August if they are to stick to the within 3 month rule. Maybe 2nd dose uptake low, or delayed further than current 3 month suggestion

185.5 million people have been vaccinated at least one dose by 7th June 2021. This includes 44.99 m fully and 140.51 m partly vaccinated! 
A minimum daily average vaccination rate of 2.12 million will need to be achieved to vaccinate 300 million people by 1st of August 2021. India is  vaccinating at ~2.86 m per day (past 7 days average).
Dates	Doses (million)
01 June 2021	2.69
02 June 2021	2.54
03 June 2021	2.67
04 June 2021	5.26
05 June 2021	1.96
06 June 2021	2.47
07 June 2021	2.45
7 days rolling Ave = 2.86 million

By Aug 1, India will need to give 2nd shot to at least 118, who will become eligible for the 2nd shot during this time. And will need to add 120m people who will receive the first shot. So 220m shots in 86 days which is ~4m shots every day on average. The vaccine supply is increasing, corporate India is pushing aggressively for vaccination, and vaccine hesitancy in decline. The current rate hovers around 3m doses. That's why I assign 90% probability by 1st Aug.

225.57 million doses have been administered by June 5, 2021. This includes 44.6 m fully and 136.27 m partly vaccinated! 
So 180.97 m people have been vaccinated at least one dose by 5th June 2021. A minimum daily average vaccination rate of 2.13 million will need to be achieved to vaccinate 300 million people by 1st of August 2021. Currently India is vaccinating at ~2.5 m per day.
Supply change bottlenecks are being resolved to increase the supply >2.5x per day. 
Question: how many could India vaccinate on a 7 days/14 days rolling basis? 800 m need to be vaccinated for herd immunity!
As early as end of June is possible

172m as of June 2. 0.2% per day getting vaccinated and increasing (~1.5m/day) so linear rate puts it at Aug 27. Shouldn't be a slow down due to saturation at that low population uptake. "The government said this week supplies are improving and it could have as many as 10 million doses a day in July and August, up from just under three million now."
https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2021/6/3/india-orders-300m-covid-shots-as-court-asks-for-vaccine-roadmap On the flip side there could be supply issues for production, but with India being a major producer they have the option of restricting exports of components or whole vaccines. The US is also likely to export more vaccines and India has been marked as a potential recipient. So it seems that issues will most likely be with execution rather than supply.
https://www.reuters.com/world/india/us-says-make-covid-19-vaccines-available-india-2021-06-03/ If they're able to effectively rapidly ramp up distribution past 3m/day it could be before Aug 1, and the desire to avoid a 4th wave could be a motivator. "The Serum Institute of India, the world's biggest manufacturer of vaccines, will make 90 million doses of AstraZeneca in June from about 65 million a month now" https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/india-reports-152734-new-covid-19-infections-3128-deaths-2021-05-31/ To be past Aug 31 it would have to fall below current rates, which there doesn't seem to be any indication of that happening. Seems better than fair odds it'll be before Aug 1 with production and uptake both increasing. I certainly won't rule out bungling of distribution though so I'll go 2-1 and adjust from there

"Serum Institute seeks indemnity from liability, says report Domestic vaccine major Serum Institute of India is seeking indemnity from liability for its COVID vaccines, saying that the rules should be same for all the companies, according to unnamed sources, reports PTI.
The development comes after requests for indemnity and exemption from bridging trials have been made by Pfizer and Moderna to the Indian government. 'Rules should be the same for everyone,' a source at the Serum Institute said.
Earlier, Serum Institute CEO Adar Poonawalla had said that vaccine manufacturers need to have protection against all lawsuits for their vaccines, especially during a pandemic.
In December 2020, speaking at an event, he said, 'we need to have the government indemnify manufacturers, especially vaccine manufacturers, against all lawsuits. In fact, COVAX and other countries have already started talking about that'."
https://www.firstpost.com/health/coronavirus-live-updates-covid-19-cases-lockdown-in-maharashtra-delhi-up-kerala-bihar-tamil-nadu-latest-news-highlights-9679831.html

Highly probable not after October. But the question is before or after August 1? My money is on before August. "India's Serum Institute will increase production of AstraZeneca (AZN.L) COVID-19 vaccines by nearly 40% in June, officials said on Monday, in the first step towards alleviating a shortage that has worsened the country's battle with coronavirus."
https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/india-reports-152734-new-covid-19-infections-3128-deaths-2021-05-31/

based on the rolling average of 2.75MM vaccinations per day and current manufacturing levels, it should be complete by July 21st. However, given the propensity and some slight delays, I think the month of August is also fair game.
218 million as of today with 2,5 million shots a day.
Current numbers and rates suggest July or August are likely to meet goal, but I expect the rate to increase.
2 milion a day, 167 milion vaccinated in May, 31. 75 days to get there. more likely to increase spead.

-Unlikely that India will make 300 million by the start of August because the current number of people vaccinated increases by around ~2 million per day. If that continues, by 31st July, the number vaccinated will be around 290 million. Therefore to meet that target doses per day has to increase. -Second doses. Given the increase in rate of first doses in the last 8 weeks or so, the number of second doses will have to increase and if there is no additional supply, then the rate of first doses will decrease. At the moment 165 million have had a vaccine and ~40 million have been fully vaccinated. To meet the 8 week time reccomendation, assuming 80% uptake of second vaccines, that means an additional 100 million vaccines on top of the 135 million to get 300 million vaccinated. If supply doesn't significantly increase between now and August, we should start to see first doses plateuing soon and second doses increasing. Likely to be on <200 million vaccinated at the start of August if so. -The government has suggested that ~2 billion doses produced between August and December which implies that it is in that timeframe we will see an increase in production, and if production is still increasing during that window rather than plateuing before it, we would expect most of that delivered towards the end of the year.  -As supply ramps up and second doses become less of an issue, August should see huge number of first doses. Assuming baseline rate of 2million/day picks back up there are 60 million done in August + unknown upside from increased production. If even 5% of that 2 billion comes in August, that's enough to make 300 million with at least one dose. -Risk is delay in supply ramping up, or limit in ability to give vaccines even with the supply increase.

India single dose inoculations are at 207.1 million on 29th May 2021. Vaccination is now open for the lower age brackets. Private sector has been engaged to expedite the vaccinations. Hesitance has come down as people learn from their mistakes. Global learning is also helping!
India vaccinating between 2.5 - 3 million people per day for the last month. assuming the lower rate it will take about 53 days to vaccinate 300 million people. this assumes no vaccine supply issues

Can't load the report from the website specified, but based on Google's chart it looks like 164 mil have received at least 1 dose, and in the past 30 days +40 mil have received at least 1 dose. There's some suggestion that the curve is accelerating (i.e. more 1st doses, though fewer 2nd doses) but if we extrapolate linearly that gets to to mid-September. I have that as my base case. Factors to consider are
+ in general, I expect vaccine manufacturing and availability to increase, but may not have a large effect over a short forecasting period
- as more of the (non-vaccine-hesitant) population gets 1st doses, the rate at which 1st doses will increase naturally slows down (but I don't expect this effect to kick in for a while, as only 12% of the population has gotten a 1st dose)

165 million 1st doses given as per government data by 30th May 2021...procured 472 million doses so far..Sputnik V  vaccination will go full fledged by August...therefore I estimates 300 million first vaccination by August 2021

At the current rate, first doses will reach 300M on October 15 in India. This is consistent with the roughly 70 million doses available each month split into 2 by first and second dose designations. In July that number is expected to go to 100M doses per month. Pfizer may also make its vaccines available in July.  [https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/05/why-covid-vaccine-producer-india-faces-major-shortage-of-doses.html]
https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/28/world/asia/india-covid-vaccine-pfizer.html

3M doses/day in Apr
1.5M doses/day in May
low estimate:  1M/day with half going to 1st dose half to 2nd - 0.5M/day means 320days for 160M new vaccines,  stay at current rate goes to first dose people and stay at current rate
High estimate go back to April rate with 2/3rd going to 1st dose so 2M/day - get there in 60 days
90 days for 1.5M/day
70 days for 2M/day
Expected improvement in vaccine availability after June 15 https://www.deccanherald.com/national/north-and-central/india-administered-43-crore-fewer-doses-of-covid-19-vaccines-in-may-990402.html

On 27 May, the daily delta across country was about 2.725 million for the first doses administered. A conservative way to estimate things would be to expect no increase/decrease in the daily counts. By this logic, the time to reach 300 M first doses would be sometime in July. (~1.6months).  The factors that could decrease the number of first doses in a day:
* number of people opting for dose 2
* unavailability of doses due to shortages
* a larger third wave of infections causing more lockdowns 
* natural calamities (like the two in the past month that disrupted vaccine drives).  The factors that can increase vaccine doses:
* diversification in the types of vaccines available 
* who approval for covaxin 
* international support with vaccine deliveries 
* ramping up vaccine supply   In my estimates, the amount of disruption that can be caused to the vaccine drives is not enough to hamper the results from the later points above. It would, in my opinion, be safe to estimate this event be in July.
